file_content.text: We're rescued!
Stupid droid! This one does not look like any liberator!
Stupid droid! This does not look like a rescue squad!
Jakarro! My most sincere apologies for his outburst. Please don't leave us here to rot; I implore you!
Do not speak for me when I have not spoken, or I will shut you off forever!
I want to know who you are and why you've been imprisoned.
Give me answers.
I'm guessing you two have no choice but to stick together?
You're quite the pair.
He is an annoyance, but he is my droid! Introduce us!
I didn't come here to listen to you bicker. Now say something useful or lose the ability to speak.
Stop arguing. [Threaten them]
You negotiate like I negotiate! I like that. Droid! Introduce us!
I am Ceetoo Deefour, former translator to Her Imminence, Queen Lina of Onderon; and this is my current master, the renowned illicit-transport specialist Jakarro.
A smuggler, in other words.
Jakarro was hired, quite innocuously, by a Selkath geneticist named Gorima. We delivered a large shipment of perfectly legal medical supplies here, to this facility.
Imagine our consternation when Gorima then had us imprisoned and interrogated most harshly by two awful creatures!
An Imp Sith and a Pub. I told them the truth, but they scheduled us for Gorima's experiments anyway.
So it's true: Darth Arkous and Colonel Darok are working together.
Arkous and Darok.
Is that significant?
Imps and Pubs in a secret alliance, droid! I have a bad feeling about this. So does this Imp here.
Imps and Pubs in a secret alliance, droid! I have a bad feeling about this. So do these Imps.
What sort of experiments would benefit from a Wookiee and a droid?
Experiments?
We don't know what Gorima is doing! I can only assume they mean to turn me to scrap and melt my processors!
I do not care about Selkath experiments. Maybe you care, but that is not all you are here for.
I saved you, meaning you owe me a life debt, Wookiee. From here on out, you do as I say.
I own you now.
I am my own Wookiee! I do not adhere to the life debt tradition! No matter who you are, you cannot tell me what to do!
Don't you think it would be best if we compromised just a bit in this instance? After all, we are, in a manner of speaking, indebted....
Do not be so weak, droid! Have some dignity!
I will not submit, but I think I have another reason to help you.
You have come to stop the Pub and the Imp, have you not?
Those who conspire against the Empire conspire against me.
Absolutely.
Darth Arkous has much to answer for.
The "Imp", if nothing else.
That's why they pay me the big credits.
You bet.
They thought I wouldn't discover their conspiracy. I'm going to show them exactly how wrong they were.
I've come to teach them.
Join me.
Join us.
An extra hand wouldn't be entirely unwelcome. Interested?
I want to know exactly what they're up to before I make any decisions.
We'll see.
A sound policy in my experience. Are we to assist them, Jakarro?
I want a chance at revenge on my captors, but I must first gather my weapons and see that my ship is intact!
We shall endeavor to hurry and regroup with you at our earliest opportunity!
It's our lucky day, droid! Convince these saps to let us out of here!
Uh... Greetings! My master compliments your impressive skill, and would like to share his appreciation for this noble rescue!
This is hardly the time for... "embellished" translations. I'm sure your master would agree.
You don't need to clarify your master's words--I understand them perfectly well.
Most people don't realize just how broad the SpecForce language training really is. Want to try that again?
Sorry, not the first Wookiee I've met. Try again.
Oh, dear. Please let us out of here! We beg you!
I beg for nothing, droid!
You--release us! We can slaughter the rest of these backstabbers together!
Why don't we start with who you are and how you got here in the first place?
I need some answers first.
Your droid seems to be missing a few pieces.
What happened to the droid?
The security here is a joke. If you were bad enough to get caught, you'll just get in the way.
You'd just slow me down.
I was not caught! I was betrayed! Droid, explain!
My esteemed master, Jakarro, is a specialist in discreet cargo delivery. I am his translator, Ceetwo Deefour, former servant of her Imminence, Queen Lina of--
No one cares, droid! Get to the point!
...Yes. Well. Jakarro was contracted by a Selkath geneticist, Gorima, to deliver certain medical equipment--perfectly legal!--to this facility.
But once the delivery was made, payment was never rendered--instead, we were imprisoned and interrogated by two very unpleasant individuals!
A Pub soldier and an Imp Sith. They asked us questions--whether we had told others about the job. Insulting!
Colonel Darok and Darth Arkous?
We were never introduced. Very rude, to be perfectly honest. After the interrogation, they told Gorima to use us as fodder for some kind of experiments!
The Sith rarely take prisoners. These experiments must be very important to them.
You're lucky to be alive.
Is it possible they thought you might have more to reveal, if they just frightened you enough?
Perhaps it was just a ploy.
What kind of genetic experiments would call for a Wookiee and a droid?
Experiments?
Thanks to your timely intervention, I hope we'll never have to find out!
Enough! You are here for the Pub soldier, yes? To punish his betrayal? We were betrayed too--we can be allies!
Their story checks out--just did a little digging on these two. Charges against them both for smuggling, disorderly conduct, assault....
...Even the droid?
Whatever they may have done, my contact has a good feeling about them--thinks they might come in handy. Let's see if she's right.
All right--we're in this together. Ready?
Sounds good.
You'd better not betray us. I'll be watching you.
Don't make me regret this.
I will secure my weapons and meet you! Revenge will be ours!
Thank you!
Those... modifications... occurred before our imprisonment here.
You get them back when you learn respect, droid!
The possibilities are... troubling, to say the least.
A psychological manipulation? Intriguing! I hadn't even considered that possibility....
Did they ask you any other questions? Anything that might explain what they're up to?
Did they say anything useful?
I'm afraid not. They were only concerned with what we knew.
I feel for you, buddy. Of course, I've only been caught once, and that was on purpose. I was on this total backwater planet called Voss....
Getting caught is no fun.
I doubt Gorima could do anything to make you stranger than you already are.
You're already weird.
I'm not sure how to interpret that remark.
Yeah. Why do you ask?
Nevermind.
Oh, you have nothing at all to worry about!
I want Darok's throat in one hand, and Arkous's throat in the other!
